titleStmt.title: The Mischief of the five shillings tax upon coal here is humbly represented that this tax is inconsistent with the safety of England, partial upon the poor, pernicious to our shipping and seamen, destructive of our river-men ..., fatal to our manufactures made with sea-coal ... and highly injurious to His Majesties revenue.

The Mischief of the five shillings tax upon coal here is humbly represented that this tax is inconsistent with the safety of England, partial upon the poor, pernicious to our shipping and seamen, destructive of our river-men ..., fatal to our manufactures made with sea-coal ... and highly injurious to His Majesties revenue.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by H. Hills, for Edward Poole ...,

notesStmt.note: "An account of the quantity or number of chaldrons of coals shipt for the coast at the port of Newcastle the years following [1661-1697]": p. 13.
Reproduction of original in: Newberry Library.
